start_page.description: The start page for the site, redirected from the site index.

url.description: The base URL (absolute URL or pathname) of the published site. Should not include a trailing slash.

robots.description: Controls generation of robots.txt if site.url is set (allowed values: allow, disallow, or custom string).

keys.description: An API key (in the form name=value) to pass to the UI model. May be specified multiple times.

branches.description: Branches as comma-separated list, an array or a list. Negate entries by prepending with a '!', use '*' as a wildcard.

edit_url.description: The default edit URL setting when no specific setting is provided.

sources.description: The list of git repositories + branch patterns to use.

tags.documentation: The default tag pattern to use when no specific pattern is provided.

content.description: The prerelease key is a marker that this version is considered prerelease. Prerelease versions are skipped when selecting the latest version of a component (unless all versions are prereleases, in which case the normal rules apply).

url.description: The URL of the UI bundle. Can be a path on the local filesystem.

snapshot.description: Whether the bundle URL points to a snapshot that changes over time.

start_path.description: The relative path inside the bundle from which to start reading files.

output_dir.description: The output directory path relative to the site root where the UI files should be written.

default_layout.description: The default layout to apply to pages that do not specify a layout.

supplemental_files.description: Supplemental file list or a directory of files to append to the UI bundle.

cache_dir.description: The cache directory. (default: antora folder under cache dir for current user)

fetch.description: Download updates from remote resources. Includes content repositories and the UI bundle.

pull.deprecationMessage: To be removed in Antora 3, use `fetch` instead.

quiet.description: Do not write any messages to stdout.

level.description: Set the minimum log level of messages that get logged.

failure_level.description: Set the log level tolerance that, when exceeded, will cause the application to fail on exit.

format.description: Specifies the format of the log messages.

extensions.description: A list of require paths for registering extensions per instance of the AsciiDoc processor.

clean.description: Remove destination path before publishing (fs only).

dir.description: The directory where the site should be published. (default: build/site)

destinations.description: A list of destinations where the generated site should be published.

path.description: The path to a git credentials file matching the format used by git-credential-store.

contents.description: The git credentials data matching the format used by git-credentials-store (optionally comma-separated).

ensure_git_suffix.description: Instructs the git client to automatically append .git to the repository URL if absent.

ensureGitSuffix.description: (Deprecated; to be removed in Antora 3) Instructs the git client to automatically append .git to the repository URL if absent.

fetch_concurrency.description: Maximum number of fetch or clone operations that are permitted to run at once.

credential_manager.description: Custom credential manager for the git client to use.

http.description: Custom HTTP request handler for the git client to use.

html_extension_style.description: The user-facing URL extension to use for HTML pages.

redirect_facility.description: The facility for handling page alias and start page redirections.

latest_version_segment_strategy.description: The strategy to use for cloaking the latest version or prerelease version segment in the URL.

latest_prerelease_version_segment.description: The value to use instead of the latest prerelease version segment in the URL.

latest_version_segment.description: The value to use instead of the latest version segment in the URL.

http_proxy.description: The URL of the proxy to use for HTTP URLs.

https_proxy.description: The URL of the proxy to use for HTTPS URLs.

no_proxy.description: A comma-separated list of domains and IPs that should not be proxied.

^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+[a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$.description:
Attributes can be set and unset.
To hard set an attribute, simply enter its value. Hard set component version attributes can’t be reassigned or unset by a page.
To soft set an attribute, attach the @ modifier to the end of its value. A page can override soft set component version attributes.
To hard unset an attribute, assign it the tilde symbol without quotes (~). Hard unset component version attributes can’t be set by a page.
To soft unset an attribute, assign the value false. A page can override soft unset component version attributes.

url.description: URL to Git repository. Can also be a relative file path.

start_path.description: Start path within the Git repository to find the Antora.

start_paths.description: Start paths within the Git repository to find the Antora.

branches.description: Branches as comma-separated list, an array or a list. Negate entries by prepending with a '!', use '*' as a wildcard.

tags.description: Tags as comma-separated list, an array or a list. Negate entries by prepending with a '!', use '*' as a wildcard.

edit_url.description: The edit URL for the current source element.

worktrees.description: The worktrees key is optional. If not specified, Antora will use the worktree if the repository is local and the current branch of that repository is among the branches matched by the branches key. If a match is made, Antora uses the files from the worktree instead of the files from the git tree for that branch. By default, Antora only uses the main worktree (not to be confused with the main branch), not linked worktrees.
